briefdescription.para: Create a cmd_ln_t from NULL-terminated list of arguments.

detaileddescription.para: This function creates a cmd_ln_t from a NULL-terminated list of argument strings. For example, to create the equivalent of passing "-hmm foodir -dsratio 2 -lm bar.lm" on the command-line:
Note that for simplicity, all arguments are passed as strings, regardless of the actual underlying type.

parameterdescription.para: Previous command-line to update, or NULL to create a new one.
Array of argument name definitions, or NULL to allow any arguments.
Whether to fail on duplicate or unknown arguments.

simplesect.para: A cmd_ln_t* containing the results of command line parsing, or NULL on failure.

briefdescription.para: Retain ownership of a command-line argument set.

simplesect.para: pointer to retained command-line argument set.

briefdescription.para: Release a command-line argument set and all associated strings.

simplesect.para: new reference count (0 if freed completely)

memberdef.argsstring: (cmd_ln_t *inout_cmdln, arg_t const *defn, int32 argc, char *argv[], int32 strict)
memberdef.name: cmd_ln_parse_r

briefdescription.para: In/Out: Previous command-line to update, or NULL to create a new one.
In: Array of argument name definitions
In: Number of actual arguments
In: Actual arguments
In: Fail on duplicate or unknown arguments, or no arguments?
Parse a list of strings into argumetns.

detaileddescription.para: Parse the given list of arguments (name-value pairs) according to the given definitions. Argument values can be retrieved in future using cmd_ln_access(). argv[0] is assumed to be the program name and skipped. Any unknown argument name causes a fatal error. The routine also prints the prevailing argument values (to stderr) after parsing.

simplesect.para: It is currently assumed that the strings in argv are allocated statically, or at least that they will be valid as long as the cmd_ln_t returned from this function. Unpredictable behaviour will result if they are freed or otherwise become invalidated.
A cmd_ln_t containing the results of command line parsing, or NULL on failure.

memberdef.name: cmd_ln_parse_file_r

In: Array of argument name definitions
In: A file that contains all the arguments
In: Fail on duplicate or unknown arguments, or no arguments?
Parse an arguments file by deliminating on " \r\t\n" and putting each tokens into an argv[] for cmd_ln_parse().

simplesect.para: A cmd_ln_t containing the results of command line parsing, or NULL on failure.

briefdescription.para: Access the generic type union for a command line argument.
Retrieve a string from a command-line object.

detaileddescription.para: The command-line object retains ownership of this string, so you should not attempt to free it manually.

simplesect.para: the string value associated with name, or NULL if name does not exist. You must use cmd_ln_exists_r() to distinguish between cases where a value is legitimately NULL and where the corresponding flag is unknown.

briefdescription.para: Retrieve an array of strings from a command-line object.

detaileddescription.para: The command-line object retains ownership of this array, so you should not attempt to free it manually.

simplesect.para: the array of strings associated with name, or NULL if name does not exist. You must use cmd_ln_exists_r() to distinguish between cases where a value is legitimately NULL and where the corresponding flag is unknown.

briefdescription.para: Retrieve an integer from a command-line object.

simplesect.para: the integer value associated with name, or 0 if name does not exist. You must use cmd_ln_exists_r() to distinguish between cases where a value is legitimately zero and where the corresponding flag is unknown.

briefdescription.para: Retrieve a floating-point number from a command-line object.

simplesect.para: the float value associated with name, or 0.0 if name does not exist. You must use cmd_ln_exists_r() to distinguish between cases where a value is legitimately zero and where the corresponding flag is unknown.

briefdescription.para: Set a string in a command-line object.

parameterdescription.para: String value to set. The command-line object does not retain ownership of this pointer.

briefdescription.para: Set an integer in a command-line object.
Set a floating-point number in a command-line object.
